verses.roman:
dina-parikṣaye nīla-kuntalair
vanaruhānanaṁ bibhrad āvṛtam
ghana-rajasvalaṁ darśayan muhur
manasi naḥ smaraṁ vīra yacchasi

synonyms: dina—of the day; parikṣaye—at the finish; nīla—dark blue; kuntalaiḥ—with locks of hair; vana-ruha—lotus; ānanam—face; bibhrat—exhibiting; āvṛtam—covered; ghana—thick; rajaḥ-valam—smeared with dust; darśayan—showing; muhuḥ—repeatedly; manasi—in the minds; naḥ—our; smaram—Cupid; vīra—O hero; yacchasi—You are placing.
translation: At the end of the day You repeatedly show us Your lotus face, covered with dark blue locks of hair and thickly powdered with dust. Thus, O hero, You arouse lusty desires in our minds.
